title.narrative: VULNERABLE ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: Output 1.5: District-level authorities resource innovative approaches and policies to reduce the incidence of adolescent suicides Youth Resource Centres (YRCs) provide outreach and awareness to vulnerable adolescents on the signs of depression, and promote help- seeking behaviour., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection Systems, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices (Covid), Health Systems Strengthening, Hiv Prevention, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: Families with children, adolescents, and young people living close to or below the national subsistence minimum are more resilient (to economic and social deprivation, and stress) and they benefit more from equitable access to quality and inclusive social services and transfers

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.5: District-level authorities resource innovative approaches and policies to reduce the incidence of adolescent suicides;Youth Resource Centres (YRCs) provide outreach and awareness to vulnerable adolescents on the signs of depression, and promote help- seeking behaviour.

description.narrative: The prioritization of adolescent mental health promotion and suicide prevention has resulted in a 42.1 percent decrease of suicide rates (33.9 boys and 54.6 percent girls) among adolescents aged 15-19 during 2011-2019.; The Health Code was signed by the President of Kazakhstan in August 2020 which endorsed the rights of adolescents at the age 16 to seek medical consultations without parental consent. The latter was a result of persistent advocacy by UNICEF and UNFPA supported by evidence from the AMHSP programme. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021

% of YRCs which have more than 20% of vulnerable young people among those continuously engaged in effective needs-focused YRC activities in accordance with the Youth Law and YRC national standards.(62402)

baseline.value: 43% from total 208 YRC (7 regions with 90 YRCs) reported on over 20% share of vulnerable youth among young people continuously engaged in effective needs-focused YRC activities as per results of 2017

actual.value: 2020:43% from total 208 YRC (7 regions with 90 YRCs) reported on over 20% share of vulnerable youth among young people continuously engaged in effective needs-focused YRC activities

title.narrative: Existence of a multi-sectoral, adolescent policy/action plan (reflecting sectoral commitments for adolescents)

target.value: 2020:Plan remains in force and is under implementation

actual.value: 2020:Plan remains in force and is under implementation
